Constructors

EventProcessorHost(String, String, String, String, ICheckpointManager, ILeaseManager) EventProcessorHost(String, String, String, String, ICheckpointManager, ILeaseManager)

Edit

Create a new host to process events from an Event Hub.

This overload of the constructor allows maximum flexibility. This one allows the caller to specify the name of the processor host as well. The overload also allows the caller to provide their own lease and checkpoint managers to replace the built-in ones based on Azure Storage.

public EventProcessorHost(string hostName, string eventHubPath, string consumerGroupName, string eventHubConnectionString, ICheckpointManager checkpointManager, ILeaseManager leaseManager)Public Sub New(hostName As String, eventHubPath As String, consumerGroupName As String, eventHubConnectionString As String, checkpointManager As ICheckpointManager, leaseManager As ILeaseManager)
Parameters
hostName
String String

Name of the processor host. MUST BE UNIQUE. Strongly recommend including a Guid to ensure uniqueness.

eventHubPath
String String

The name of the EventHub.

consumerGroupName
String String

The name of the consumer group within the Event Hub.

eventHubConnectionString
String String

Connection string for the Event Hub to receive from.

checkpointManager
ICheckpointManager ICheckpointManager

Object implementing ICheckpointManager which handles partition checkpointing.

leaseManager
ILeaseManager ILeaseManager

Object implementing ILeaseManager which handles leases for partitions.

EventProcessorHost(String, String, String, String, String) EventProcessorHost(String, String, String, String, String)

Edit

Create a new host to process events from an Event Hub.

Since Event Hubs are frequently used for scale-out, high-traffic scenarios, generally there will be only one host per process, and the processes will be run on separate machines. However, it is supported to run multiple hosts on one machine, or even within one process, if throughput is not a concern.

This overload of the constructor uses the default, built-in lease and checkpoint managers. The Azure Storage account specified by the storageConnectionString parameter is used by the built-in managers to record leases and checkpoints.

public EventProcessorHost(string eventHubPath, string consumerGroupName, string eventHubConnectionString, string storageConnectionString, string leaseContainerName)Public Sub New(eventHubPath As String, consumerGroupName As String, eventHubConnectionString As String, storageConnectionString As String, leaseContainerName As String)
Parameters
eventHubPath
String String

The name of the EventHub.

consumerGroupName
String String

The name of the consumer group within the Event Hub.

eventHubConnectionString
String String

Connection string for the Event Hub to receive from.

storageConnectionString
String String

Connection string to Azure Storage account used for leases and checkpointing.

leaseContainerName
String String

Azure Storage container name for use by built-in lease and checkpoint manager.

Methods

RegisterEventProcessorAsync<T>() RegisterEventProcessorAsync(Of T)()

Edit

This registers IEventProcessor implementation with the host using Microsoft.Azure.EventHubs.Processor.DefaultEventProcessorFactory`1.
This also starts the host and causes it to start participating in the partition distribution process.

public Task RegisterEventProcessorAsync<T>()where T : IEventProcessor, new ()Public Function RegisterEventProcessorAsync(Of T As {IEventProcessor, New}) As Task
Returns
Task Task

A task to indicate EventProcessorHost instance is started.

This registers IEventProcessor implementation with the host using Microsoft.Azure.EventHubs.Processor.DefaultEventProcessorFactory`1.
This also starts the host and causes it to start participating in the partition distribution process.

EventProcessorOptions EventProcessorOptions

Microsoft.Azure.EventHubs.Processor.EventProcessorHost.EventProcessorOptions to control various aspects of message pump created when ownership is acquired for a particular partition of EventHub.

A task to indicate EventProcessorHost instance is started.

RegisterEventProcessorFactoryAsync(IEventProcessorFactory) RegisterEventProcessorFactoryAsync(IEventProcessorFactory)

Edit

This registers IEventProcessorFactory implementation with the host which is used to create an instance of IEventProcessor when it takes ownership of a partition. This also starts the host and causes it to start participating in the partition distribution process.
